job_title: Anonymous Employee in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros:
Flexible
Trustworthy
Lovely people to work with
cons:
No Career progression
No annual pay review

job_title: Support Worker in Derry, Northern Ireland
pros: Colleagues, clients, helping others, getting experience
cons: Management for sure. The project was run by an incompetent manager. The team leaders and support workers picked up the slack from the manager.

review_title: Love of the Job only goes so far
job_title: Mental Health Support Worker in Portadown, Craigavon, Northern Ireland
pros: Great staff team Rewarding work Amazing to see progress in service users Good training Flexible work
cons: The pay is ridiculously low Don't listen to staff concerns Very low rate of pay for lone working "sleep" ins... very little sleep For a "charity" that has so much profit it never reaches the staff

job_title: PBS Practitioner in Lisburn, Northern Ireland
pros: supportive management, great team atmosphere
cons: pay does not reflect the work involved

review_title: Good if you get a good scheme
job_title: Relief Support Worker in Bangor, Northern Ireland
pros: People you work with are usually all dead on Rewarding when you make a difference Very laid back (scheme dependant) Often extra shifts available
cons: Pay is very low, though that is being looked at currently Can be mentally draining over full time hours (32hours is the sweet spot)

review_title: Underpaid for hard but rewarding work
job_title: Mental Health Support Worker in Manchester, England
pros: Rewarding, good experience working in mental health, great team, good training available
cons: Pay is low for workload, shift work, pay is often wrong

job_title: Disability Support Worker in Derry, Northern Ireland
pros: Management is decent and can be very helpful depending on which branch you work for.
cons: Pay isn't great considering what you have to accomplish on a shift.

job_title: in Ballyclare, Northern Ireland
pros:
lovely service users,
great team/co-workers
cons:
Minimum wage for the amount of responsibility we have.
Lone working,
Managers always criticise which creates very low moral, don't feel appreciated 
Sleep overs creates very long shift (24hrs)

job_title: Support Worker in Bangor, Northern Ireland
pros: Good staff team, supportive manager, good training.
cons: Hours can be long, sleepovers required.

job_title: Team Leader in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Not sure there was any apart from door out of there
cons:
Having to cover night shift after a long day shift when agency staff don't weigh in 
Pay - rubbish
Support services - non existent.
Toxic culture
No team cohesion - no trust, staff competing with each other 
Hard to book AL

review_title: Dangerous clients, no support, minimum wage
job_title: Night Support Worker in Birmingham, England
pros: Stable job, good training program
cons: The company works with clients who dont fit to any other service and require very complex care. Praxis does not employ people with mental health nurse qualification, or any other related qualification, but employ people without experience. That’s how they put inexperienced employees in dangerous situations. Physical and mental harm was done on several occasions to care workers, and the management always wait till things get out of hand before acting. The job they offer is not support work but serious care work.

job_title: PBS Practitioner in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Enjoyable work and great staff
cons: No job progression for support staff.

review_title: Not well paid but a caring company
job_title: Mental Health Support Worker in Manchester, England
pros: Caring and understanding company to work for. Flexible.
cons: Underpaid, poor technology / very outdated, understaffed which is stressful

job_title: Positive Behaviour Support Lead in Lisburn, Northern Ireland
pros: An exciting company to work for, which is going through a sustained period of growth and development. Seeking innovative ways to passionately care for individuals with complex needs. Praxis are committed to shape care around the individual; but also committed to their staff. With a major focus on learning and development, training at both induction and continuing this through your career. For example praxis are putting me though a level 5 in leadership and management! Highly recommended.
cons: Staff at scheme level could be better utilised for policy/document development and feedback.

job_title: Marketing and Communications Officer in Lisburn, Northern Ireland
pros: Worked at Praxis Care for a short time now but I really enjoy working here, the people are friendly and the manager are helpful
cons: Pay could be better but there is opportunity to grow

review_title: Okay place to work. Management needs work
job_title: Support Worker in Newtownards, Northern Ireland
pros:
Staff are fab
Support from co workers
……

job_title: Scheme Manager in Belfast, Northern Ireland

cons: lack of support from senior leadership

review_title: Great company to work with extremely friendly staff
job_title: Recruitment Administrator in Belfast, Northern Ireland

job_title: Team Leader in Belfast, Northern Ireland

Supportive Team and Managers
Management invest in your career
Lots o training opportunities
Good pay
cons: No main cons, maybe a bit lonely working from home, but thats really it

job_title: Team Leader in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Sorry there isnt any pros I found
cons: High staff turnover, staff unhappy, top management offsite making operational decisions which negatively affect staff ability to do job, no real teamwork, staff employment policies written to favour more senior managemen with better terms and conditions, length of service overlooked. Management take a draconian approach to staffing, suspend staff rather than sort out issues  before it comes to that.

review_title: Very Friendly and Opportunity to Progress

job_title: Support Worker in Derry, Northern Ireland

Good staff and workforce.

job_title: Mental Health Support Worker in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Getting to work with those who are in need of support, for a company that is well established in the region.
cons: Much of the time we were engaging in damage limitation rather than psychological growth and promoting wellness.

job_title: Positive Behaviour Support Practitioner in Lisburn, Northern Ireland

Opportunity for growth in company
